docs.lead_paragraph: Five conservative thinkers outline the ideas they believe Republicans should offer to President Obama in Thursday’s health care meeting.

headline.seo: How the G.O.P. Can Fix Health Care
headline.main: How the G.O.P. Can Fix Health Care
headline.print_headline: How the G.O.P. Can Fix Health Care

docs.snippet: Five conservative thinkers outline the ideas they believe Republicans should offer to President Obama in Thursday’s health care meeting.

byline.original: By BILL FRIST, MARK McCLELLAN, JAMES P. PINKERTON,  CHARLES KOLB and NEWT GINGRICH

docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Americans think about health care, they think first of health, not finance. They go to the doctor to get well, not to show off their government-issued insurance card. So President Obama's health care reform plan was doomed from the moment the American people figured out that his goal was to spend less on health care. While the president's idea of ''bending the curve'' on health care means cuts in Medicare, to the American people bending the curve means living better and longer. To the folks on Main Street, it means not appointing Kafkaesque committees to measure ''quality-adjusted life years'' but fostering a vibrant climate of scientific research and opening a wider pipeline for new medicines.

headline.main: How the G.O.P. Can Fix Health Care

docs.abstract: James P Pinkerton Op-Ed article holds that when Americans think about health care, they think first of health, not finance, and thus Pres Obama's health care reform plan was doomed from moment American people figured out that his goal was to spend less; argues that reform should foster vibrant climate of scientific research and open wider pipeline for new medicines; drawing (M)
